schemas.name: sample_registration
schemas.description: The collection of data elements required to register a sample in the CQDG program. Registration of samples is required before molecular and clinical data submission can proceed.

fields.name: study_id
fields.description: Identifier for the Study

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Identifier of the participant assigned by the data provider.

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: submitter_biospecimen_id
fields.description: Identifier of the biospecimen assigned by the data provider.

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: submitter_sample_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the molecular sample assigned by the data provider

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.description: Type of molecular sample used for analysis testing
fields.name: sample_type

schemas.name: study
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a specific study in the CQDG program.

fields.name: study_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the Study

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the Study

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the Study

fields.name: keyword
fields.description: Keywords associated with the Study

meta.notes: Provide a semicolon (;) delimited list of keywords

fields.name: access_authority
fields.description: Contact information for the Stuy's Access Authority

meta.notes: Provide website or email information

fields.name: domain
fields.description: Research domain of the Study

fields.name: population
fields.description: Describe the population that is the focus of the study

fields.name: access_limitations
fields.description: Data access limitations as defined in the GA4GH Data Use Ontology (DUO)

meta.notes: Refer to the Data Use Ontology https://github.com/EBISPOT/DUO

fields.name: access_requirements
fields.description: Data use requirements as defined in the GA4GH Data Use Ontology (DUO)

meta.notes: Refer to the Data Use Ontology https://github.com/EBISPOT/DUO

fields.name: biospecimen_access
fields.description: Biospecimen may be accessed (consent type)

schemas.name: participant
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a specific participant in the CQDG program.

fields.name: study_id
fields.description: Identifier for the Study

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant assigned by the data provider
fields.name: submitter_participant_id

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.description: Participant's age (in days) at recruitment
fields.name: age_at_recruitment

meta.displayName: Age of participant (in days) at recruitment

fields.description: Sex of the participant
fields.name: sex

meta.notes: Data from administrative health records or self-reported

fields.description: Ethnic background of the participant
fields.name: ethnicity

meta.notes: French Canadian trace their ancestry to French colonists who settled in Canada, English Canadians are of English ethnic origin and heritage.

fields.description: Participant's last known state of living or deceased
fields.name: vital_status

fields.description: Indicates the cause of a participant's death
fields.name: cause_of_death

meta.notes: Cause of death is only required to be submitted if the participant's vital_status is 'Deceased'.

fields.description: Participant's age (in days) at the time of death
fields.name: age_of_death

meta.notes: Age_of_death is only required to be submitted if the participant's vital_status is 'Deceased'.

schemas.name: biospecimen
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a participant's biospecimen. A biospecimen is any material sample taken for testing, diagnostic or research purposes. To submit multiple biospecimens for a single participant, submit multiple rows in the biospecimens file for this participant.

fields.name: study_id
fields.description: Identifier for the Study

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Identifier of the participant assigned by the data provider

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: submitter_biospecimen_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the biospecimen assigned by the data provider

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.description: Participant's age (in days) when biospecimen was collected
fields.name: age_biospecimen_collection

fields.description: Tissue source of the biospecimen
fields.name: biospecimen_tissue_source

meta.notes: Terms are taken from NCI Thesaurus (NCIt) at http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ncit.owl

fields.name: tumor_normal_designation
fields.description: Description of specimen tumor/normal status for data processing

meta.notes: Indicate `Not applicable' if the biospecimen was not analysed.

fields.name: cancer_biospecimen_type
fields.description: Description of the kind of biospecimen that was collected (specific to cancer) based on  NCI Thesaurus (NCIt)

fields.name: cancer_biospecimen_anatomic_location_source_text
fields.description: Indicate the anatomic location where the biospecimen was collected (cancer specific)

meta.notes: Use the term that was used when collecting the biospecimen

fields.name: cancer_biospecimen_anatomic_location_ncit_code
fields.description: Indicate the  NCI Thesaurus (NCIt) code for the anatomic location of the biospecimen

meta.notes: Refer to  NCI Thesaurus (NCIt) at http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ncit.owl

fields.name: tumor_histological_type_source_text
fields.description: The histology of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report

meta.notes: Use the term that was used in the pathology report

fields.name: tumor_histological_type_ncit_code
fields.description: The code to represent the histology of neoplasms according to NCI Thesaurus (NCIt)

meta.notes: If biospecimen is a tumor refer to NCI Thesaurus (NCIt) at http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ncit.owl

schemas.name: Diagnosis
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a participant's diagnosis. To submit multiple diagnoses for a single participant, submit multiple rows in the diagnosis file for this participant.

fields.name: study_id
fields.description: Identifier for the Study

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Identifier of the participant assigned by the data provider

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: diagnosis_source_text
fields.description: Condition as reported in the study's dataset

meta.notes: Provide exact information as per the dataset

fields.name: diagnosis_ICD_code
fields.description: ICD-10 code used to define a condtion

meta.notes: Write the exact ICD-10 code - refer to https://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/ClassificationDownload/DLArea/Download.aspx

fields.name: diagnosis_mondo_code
fields.description: Mondo code used to define a condtion

meta.notes: Write the exact MONDO code. For MONDO codes, refer to https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/mondo

fields.name: age_at_diagnosis
fields.description: Participant's age (in days) at diagnosis of condition

fields.name: is_cancer
fields.description: The diagnosis is a cancer diagnosis

fields.name: is_cancer_primary
fields.description: Diagnosis is a primary cancer diagnosis

meta.notes: This field is only required to be submitted if the participant's diagnosis is cancer

fields.name: tumor_staging_system
fields.description: Indicate the tumor staging system used to stage the cancer at the time of the diagnosis, prior to treatment

fields.name: stage_group
fields.description: Stage group of the tumor, as assigned by the reporting tumor_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumor stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.)

script:
(function validate(inputs) {
        let result = {valid: true, message: 'Ok'};

        const {$row, $name} = inputs;
        const $field = $row[$name];

        if(!$field){
            return result;
        }

        const isCancer = $row.is_cancer && $row.is_cancer.trim().toLowerCase() == "true";

        if ($field && !$row.tumor_staging_system) {
            result = {
                valid: false,
                message: `Please provide a value for the tumor_staging_system or leave stage_group blank`,
            };
        }

        if (isCancer && !$field) {
            result = {
                valid: false,
                message: `The stage_group mandatory if the is_cancer flag is set to 1/true`,
            };
        }

        if ($field) {
            let codeList = [];
            switch ($row.tumor_staging_system && $row.tumor_staging_system.trim().toLowerCase()) {
                case 'revised international staging system (riss)':
                    codeList = ['stage i', 'stage ii', 'stage iii'];
                    break;
                case 'lugano staging system':
                    codeList = [
                        'stage i',
                        'stage ia',
                        'stage ib',
                        'stage ie',
                        'stage iea',
                        'stage ieb',
                        'stage ii',
                        'stage iia',
                        'stage iib',
                        'stage iie',
                        'stage iiea',
                        'stage iieb',
                        'stage iii',
                        'stage iiia',
                        'stage iiib',
                        'stage iv',
                        'stage iva',
                        'stage ivb',
                    ];
                    break;
                case 'st jude staging system':
                    codeList = ['stage i', 'stage ii', 'stage iii', 'stage iv'];
                    break;
                case 'ann arbor staging system':
                    codeList = [
                        'stage i',
                        'stage ia',
                        'stage ib',
                        'stage ie',
                        'stage is',
                        'stage ii',
                        'stage iia',
                        'stage iib',
                        'stage iie',
                        'stage iis',
                        'stage iii',
                        'stage iiia',
                        'stage iiib',
                        'stage iiie',
                        'stage iiis',
                        'stage iv',
                        'stage iva',
                        'stage ivb',
                        'stage ive',
                        'stage ivs',
                    ];
                    break;
                case 'rai staging system':
                    codeList = ['stage 0', 'stage i', 'stage ii', 'stage iii', 'stage iv'];
                    break;
                case 'durie-salmon staging system':
                    codeList = [
                        'stage 1',
                        'stage 1a',
                        'stage 1b',
                        'stage ii',
                        'stage iia',
                        'stage iib',
                        'stage iii',
                        'stage iiia',
                        'stage iiib',
                    ];
                    break;
                case 'figo staging system':
                    codeList = [
                        'stage ia',
                        'stage ia1',
                        'stage ia2',
                        'stage ib',
                        'stage ib1',
                        'stage ib2',
                        'stage iia',
                        'stage iab',
                        'stage iiia',
                        'stage iiib',
                        'stage iva',
                        'stage ivb',
                    ];
                    break;
                case 'binet staging system':
                    codeList = ['stage a', 'stage b', 'stage c'];
                    break;
                case 'ajcc 8th edition':
                    codeList = [
                        'stage 0',
                        'stage 0a',
                        'stage 0is',
                        'stage i',
                        'stage ia',
                        'stage ia1',
                        'stage ia2',
                        'stage ia3',
                        'stage ib',
                        'stage ib1',
                        'stage ib2',
                        'stage ic',
                        'stage ie',
                        'stage is',
                        'stage ii',
                        'stage iia',
                        'stage iia1',
                        'stage iia2',
                        'stage iib',
                        'stage iic',
                        'stage iie',
                        'stage iii',
                        'stage iiia',
                        'stage iiia1',
                        'stage iiia2',
                        'stage iiib',
                        'stage iiic',
                        'stage iiic1',
                        'stage iiic2',
                        'stage iiid',
                        'stage iv',
                        'stage iva',
                        'stage iva1',
                        'stage iva2',
                        'stage ivb',
                        'stage ivc',
                        'occult carcinoma',
                        'stage 1',
                    ];
                    break;
                case 'ajcc 7th edition':
                    codeList = [
                        'stage 0',
                        'stage 0a',
                        'stage 0is',
                        'stage i',
                        'stage ia',
                        'stage ia1',
                        'stage ia2',
                        'stage ib',
                        'stage ib1',
                        'stage ib2',
                        'stage ic',
                        'stage is',
                        'stage ii',
                        'stage iia',
                        'stage iia1',
                        'stage iia2',
                        'stage iib',
                        'stage iic',
                        'stage iii',
                        'stage iiia',
                        'stage iiib',
                        'stage iiic',
                        'stage iiic1',
                        'stage iiic2',
                        'stage iv',
                        'stage iva',
                        'stage iva1',
                        'stage iva2',
                        'stage ivb',
                        'stage ivc',
                        'occult carcinoma',
                        'stage 1',
                    ];
                    break;
                default:
                    codelist = [];
            }

            if (!codeList.includes($field.trim().toLowerCase()) && codeList.length) {
                const msg = `'${$field}' is not a permissible value. When 'tumor_staging_system' is set to '${
                    $row.tumor_staging_system
                }', 'stage_group' must be one of the following: \n${codeList
                    .map((code) => `- "${code}"`)
                    .join('\n')}`;

                result.valid = false;
                result.message = msg;
            }
        }
        return result;
    })

meta.notes: This field is dependent on the selected tumor_staging_system

fields.name: t_category
fields.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumor (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected tumor_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: n_category
fields.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected tumor_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

fields.name: m_category
fields.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected tumor_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

schemas.name: treatment
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a participant's treatment at a specific point in the clinical record. To submit multiple treatments for a single participant, please submit treatment rows in the treatment file for this participant.

fields.name: study_id
fields.description: Identifier for the Study

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Identifier of the participant assigned by the data provider

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: submitter_diagnosis_id
fields.description: Indicate the diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this treatment was related to

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: treatment_type
fields.description: Indicate the type of treatment the participant received

fields.name: treatment_is_primary
fields.description: Indicate if the treatment is the primary treatment following the initial diagnosis

fields.name: treatment_intent
fields.description: The purpose of the treatment

fields.name: treatment_response
fields.description: The participant's response to the treatment

fields.name: medication_name
fields.description: medication name (common term)

fields.name: medication_code
fields.description: Drug identification number (DIN code)

meta.notes: The DIN uniquely identifies the manufacturer, product name, active ingredient(s), strength(s) of active ingredient(s);pharmaceutical form and route of administration.

fields.name: medication_class
fields.description: Drug class based on ATC (Anatomical Therapeutic Class)

meta.notes: Refer to the WHO ATC https://www.whocc.no/atc_ddd_index/ to classify the active ingredients of drug according to the organ or system on which it acts and its therapeutic, pharmacological and chemical properties. Drugs should be coded at the 5th level of the ATC.

fields.description: Date when treatment started (DD-MM-YYYY)
fields.name: treatment_start_date

meta.notes: For medication, provide date of first prescription dispensation (DD-MM-YYYY). For one-time treatments, such as surgeries, provide the date of the intervention.

fields.description: Date when treatment ended (DD-MM-YYYY)
fields.name: treatment_end_date

meta.notes: For medication, provide date of last prescription dispensation (DD-MM-YYYY). Leave blank for one-time treatments such as sugeries.

schemas.name: follow_up
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a specific follow-up visit by a participant with a cancer diagnosis. A follow-up is defined as any point of contact with a patient after primary cancer diagnosis. To submit multiple follow-ups for a single participant, submit multiple rows in the follow-up file for this participant.

fields.name: study_id
fields.description: Identifier for the Study

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.description: Identifier of the participant assigned by the data provider
fields.name: submitter_participant_id

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: submitter_diagnosis_id
fields.description: Identifier of the diagnosis event assigned by the data provider.

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.description: Number of days between primary diagnosis and follow-up event
fields.name: days_to_follow_up

fields.description: Indicate the participant's disease status at time of follow-up
fields.name: disease_status_at_followup
relapse_interval
fields.description: Time interval between end of primary treatment and disease progression (in days)

meta.notes: If the participant was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or recurrence or progression (for liquid tumors) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.

schemas.name: exposure
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a participant's exposure to specific risk factors.

fields.name: study_id
fields.description: Identifier for the Study

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant assigned by the data provider

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: smoking_status
fields.description: Smoking status of a patient at the time of the data collection

fields.name: alcohol_status
fields.description: Current alcohol consumtion based on recommended daily limit

codeList: Alcohol intake within recommended daily limit
Alcohol intake exceeds recommended daily limit

meta.notes: Refer to the Canadian Centre on Substance Abuse, for men, no more than 15 drinks a week, with no more than 3 drinks a day most days. No more than 4 drinks on any single occasion. For women, no more than 10 drinks a week, with no more than 2 drinks a day most days. No more than 3 drinks on any single occasion.

fields.name: FSA
fields.description: Forward Sortation Area (3-digit postal code)

meta.notes: Forward Sortaion Area (FSA) is the 3 first digits of the postal code

schemas.name: phenotype
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a participant's phenotypes. To submit multiple phenotypes for a single participant, submit multiple rows in the phenotype file for this participant.

fields.name: study_id
fields.description: Identifier for the Study

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Identifier of the participant assigned by the data provider

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: phenotype_source_text
fields.description: Phenotype (or abnormality) as reported in the study's dataset

meta.notes: Provide exact information as per the dataset

fields.name: phenotype_HPO_code
fields.description: Code used for the phenotype in the Human Phenotype Ontology terminology

meta.notes: Write the exact code used in the HPO, for instance: HP:0001161. Please refer to the Human Phenotype Ontology at https://hpo.jax.org/app/ for code identification.

fields.name: age_at_phenotype
fields.description: Participant's age (in days) when phenotype was observed

fields.name: phenotype_observed
fields.description: Indicate if the phenotype is observed

schemas.name: family
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to a family and relationships within this family. This table should be completed only if the Study is contributing data from groups of participants who share family ties (ex: twins, trios, sib-pairs).

fields.name: study_id
fields.description: Identifier for the Study

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: submitter_family_id
fields.description: Identifier of the family assigned by the data provider

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant assigned by the data provider
fields.name: submitter_participant_id

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: family_type
fields.description: Type of family-based study design
Indicate if the participant is a proband or a family member
fields.name: is_a_proband
relationship_to_proband
fields.description: Relationship of the participant to the proband

meta.displayName: Relationship of the participant to the proband

fields.name: is_affected
fields.description: Is affected by the condition

schemas.name: family_history
schemas.description: The collection of data elements related to the participant's family health history. To submit multiple conditions for a single participant' family, submit multiple rows in the family history file for this participant.

fields.name: study_id
fields.description: Identifier for the Study

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.description: Identifier of the participant assigned by the data provider
fields.name: submitter_participant_id

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

fields.name: family_condition_name
fields.description: Name of the condition observed in a family member

fields.name: family_condition_relationship
fields.description: What is the relationship of the family member to the participant.

meta.notes: Refer to HL7 code system to identify the type of relationship between the participant and the affected family member http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-RoleCode
